## Transportation Demand and Network Modeling

### Network & OD Data
- **[Travel Forecasting, Explained](https://tfresource.org/)** — a community-maintained knowledge base for demand modeling; hat tip to [Greg Macfarlane](https://gregmacfarlane.github.io/).
- **[Transportation Networks](https://github.com/bstabler/TransportationNetworks)** — curated benchmark city networks compiled by Ben Stabler.
- **[MATSim Scenarios](https://github.com/matsim-scenarios)** — ready-to-run multi-agent transport scenarios for MATSim experiments.
- **[UniTA](https://github.com/xuxiaotong/A_unified_and_validated_traffic_dataset_for_20_U.S._cities)** — unified traffic assignment datasets spanning 20 U.S. cities (nickname provided here until the authors coin an official one).
- **[WardropNet](https://github.com/tumBAIS/ML-CO-pipeline-TrafficPrediction)** — ICLR 2025 benchmark for equilibrium-augmented traffic flow prediction.
- **[LargeOD](https://github.com/tsinghua-fib-lab/CommutingODGen-Dataset)** — ICLR 2025 dataset for large-scale commuting OD generation.
- **[GNN4UE](https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/_b_Equilibrium-Traffic-Networks_b_/27889251)** — user-equilibrium traffic flow datasets for graph neural network prediction contributed by [Bahman Madadi](https://github.com/bahmanmdd).

### Tooling & Workflows
- **[OSMnx](https://osmnx.readthedocs.io/en/stable/)** — award-winning toolkit by [Geoff Boeing](https://geoffboeing.com/) for downloading, modeling, and analyzing street networks.
- **[osm2gmns](https://pypi.org/project/osm2gmns/1.0.0rc1/)** — converts OpenStreetMap data into GMNS format; developed by Jiawei Lu and Xuesong (Simon) Zhou.
- **[DTALite](https://github.com/asu-trans-ai-lab/DTALite)** — ASU Transportation AI Lab's macroscopic/mesoscopic AMS library that natively reads GMNS.
- **[DTA](https://github.com/DrKeHan/DTA)** — Dr. Ke Han's open-source dynamic user equilibrium solver (see Networks and Spatial Economics, 2019).
- **[OSRM](https://project-osrm.org/)** — C++14 routing engine providing lightning-fast shortest path queries.

### Research Benchmarks
- **[WardropNet](https://openreview.net/forum?id=7FHSPd3SRE)** and **[LargeOD](https://openreview.net/forum?id=WeJEidTzff)** — paired ICLR 2025 papers outlining reproducible evaluation pipelines.
- **[GNN4UE](https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/_b_Equilibrium-Traffic-Networks_b_/27889251)** — includes starter baselines for graph learning atop equilibrium traffic networks.

## Discrete Choice Modeling

### Benchmarks & Toolkits
- **[Choice-Learn](https://github.com/artefactory/choice-learn)** — Python-first framework for training and benchmarking large-scale discrete choice models.
- **[DNN for Choice Modeling](https://github.com/siqi-feng/DNN-behavioral-regularity)** — code accompanying the TR-C paper on enforcing behavioral regularity with gradient penalties.
- **[Apollo](https://www.apollochoicemodelling.com/examples.html)** — freeware choice-model estimation suite (Hess & Palma, 2019); shoutout to [Siqi Feng](https://daziano.cee.cornell.edu/members/) for the pointer.

### Datasets

- **[Swissmetro](https://transp-or.epfl.ch/pythonbiogeme/examples_swissmetro.html)** — canonical dataset for testing discrete choice specifications (thanks again to Siqi).

## Traffic Dynamics and Control

### Vehicle Trajectory Data

- **[pNEUMA](https://open-traffic.epfl.ch/)** — large-scale drone capture over Athens for microscopic trajectory analysis.
- **Songdo dataset** — paired [traffic](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13828384) and [vision](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13828408) releases documenting the Songdo smart-city corridor.
- **[Waymo Open Dataset](https://waymo.com/open/)** — richly annotated autonomous-driving trajectories.
- **[I-24 MOTION](https://i24motion.org/data)** — long-horizon freeway trajectories from Tennessee's instrumented corridor.
- **[MiTra](https://opara.zih.tu-dresden.de/items/68482417-ddc5-40ac-885a-83124bd459e8)** — drone-based all-traffic-state freeway dataset collected near Milan.
- **[TGSIM I-294](https://data.transportation.gov/Automobiles/Third-Generation-Simulation-Data-TGSIM-I-294-L1-Tr/7zjf-a4zf/about_data)** — third-generation simulation data for I-294 in Chicago.
- **[Zen Traffic Data](https://zen-traffic-data.net/english/)** — extensive Japanese freeway sensor archive.
- **[OpenACC](https://data.jrc.ec.europa.eu/dataset/9702c950-c80f-4d2f-982f-44d06ea0009f)** — Adaptive Cruise Control experiments from the Joint Research Centre.
- **[microSIM-ACC](https://github.com/microSIM-ACC)** — open code + datasets for microscopic ACC controller evaluation.

### Ring-Road Experiments ([The Lord of the Rings](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3494577))
- **Nagoya Traffic Jam Experiment** — [download trajectories](https://github.com/mathematical-society-of-traffic-flow/mathematical-society-of-traffic-flow.github.io/raw/refs/heads/main/assets/data/data.zip).
- **Dome Traffic Jam Experiment** — [circular arena trajectories](https://github.com/mathematical-society-of-traffic-flow/mathematical-society-of-traffic-flow.github.io/raw/refs/heads/main/assets/data/trajectory.zip).
- **[Arizona Ring Experiments Dataset (ARED)](https://ir.vanderbilt.edu/items/2e6f1c05-0174-4abd-b71c-e7e40eae0ce3)** — autonomous-vehicle dampening experiments from Vanderbilt.

### Freeway Traffic Control
- **[Flow-Lite](https://github.com/mit-wu-lab/automatic_vehicular_control)** — lightweight sibling of [Flow](https://flow-project.github.io) without RLlib, ideal for rapid freeway controller prototyping.

### Urban Traffic Control
- **[Intersection Zoo](https://github.com/mit-wu-lab/IntersectionZoo)** — ICLR 2025 benchmark for multi-agent eco-driving at signalized intersections.

## Traffic Simulation
_General-purpose simulators that complement the DTA-focused resources above._

- **[UXSim](https://github.com/toruseo/UXsim)** — mesoscopic simulator by [Toru Seo](https://toruseo.jp/) for large-scale experiments.
- **[DTALite](https://github.com/asu-trans-ai-lab/DTALite)** — doubles as a simulator when you need AMS-style macroscopic and mesoscopic assignment.
- **[sym-metanet](https://github.com/FilippoAiraldi/sym-metanet)** — Python implementation of the METANET macroscopic control framework by [Filippo Airaldi](https://filippoairaldi.github.io/).

## Spatio-Temporal Data and Modeling
- **[Spatiotemporal Data](https://spatiotemporal-data.github.io/)** — curated catalog of datasets, models, and code for spatio-temporal learning.

## Road Safety
- **[Surrogate Safety Measures](https://github.com/Yiru-Jiao/SSMsOnPlane)** — open implementations of plane-based SSMs from [Yiru Jiao](https://github.com/Yiru-Jiao).
- **[SHRP2NDS-BEVTR](https://github.com/Yiru-Jiao/BirdsEyeTrajectoryReconstructionSHRP2NDS)** — bird's-eye reconstructions of SHRP2 naturalistic driving data with crash/near-crash labels (also courtesy of Yiru).

## Mobility Services
- **[FleetPy](https://github.com/TUM-VT/FleetPy)** — open-source fleet simulation framework (seven-plus reference projects and counting!).

## Optimization
- **[RL4CO](https://rl4co.readthedocs.io/en/latest/docs/content/intro/environments/)** — reinforcement-learning-for-combinatorial-optimization environments collected under one documented roof.

## Transportation and AI

### Generative & Tutorial Resources
- **[DGMinTransportation](https://github.com/UMN-Choi-Lab/DGMinTransportation)** — companion repo for “A Gentle Introduction and Tutorial on Deep Generative Models in Transportation Research” from [UMN-Choi-Lab](https://choi-seongjin.github.io/index.html).

### Traffic Prediction via Deep Learning

_Still one of the hottest intersections between AI and transportation — here are curated entry points._

- **[Deep learning models for traffic prediction](https://github.com/aptx1231/Traffic-Prediction-Open-Code-Summary)** — Jiawei Jiang’s catalog of open-source prediction models and codebases.
- **[LibCity](https://libcity.ai/)** — unified benchmark covering spatio-temporal datasets, models, and evaluation tooling.

## Data Standards in Transportation
- **[GTFS and more](https://github.com/MobilityData/awesome-transit)** — MobilityData’s definitive list covering GTFS, NeTEx, and emerging mobility data specs.


## Notable Figures in Transportation
- **[Dietrich Braess](https://homepage.ruhr-uni-bochum.de/dietrich.braess/#paradox)** — of Braess’s Paradox fame: adding a link can slow everyone down.
- **[Markos Papageorgiou](http://www.dssl.tuc.gr/en/members/papageorgiou_cv.htm)** — start with this [InControl podcast episode](https://www.incontrolpodcast.com/1632769/episodes/17836860-ep36-markos-papageorgiou-traffic-control-theory-and-practice) for a tour of modern traffic control.

## Miscellaneous
- **[Optuna](https://optuna.org/)** — automatic hyperparameter optimization framework (thanks to [Alex Richardson](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=BB-pmW0AAAAJ&hl=en) for the recommendation).
- **[OSMnx Matplotlib animation](https://github.com/mikhailsirenko/osmnx-matplotlib-animation)** — visualize your personal mobility over urban networks.
- **[Edge-bundling tool for regional mobility flow data](https://zenodo.org/records/14532548)** — high-impact flow visualizations for regional planning.

## How to Contribute?

If you have a dataset or benchmark to contribute, you can:

1. Open an [issue](https://github.com/RRinTransportation/awesome-rerite/issues)

2. Submit a pull request  

3. Contact me via [email](junyi.ji@vanderbilt.edu)

```{=html}
<button class="back-to-top" aria-label="Back to top">↑ Top</button>
<script>
    const backToTopBtn = document.querySelector('.back-to-top');
    const toggleBtnVisibility = () => {
        if (!backToTopBtn) return;
        if (window.scrollY > 400) {
            backToTopBtn.classList.add('show');
        } else {
            backToTopBtn.classList.remove('show');
        }
    };

    window.addEventListener('scroll', toggleBtnVisibility);
    toggleBtnVisibility();

    backToTopBtn?.addEventListener('click', () => {
        window.scrollTo({ top: 0, behavior: 'smooth' });
    });
</script>
```
